alert.note: Alert for Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Falls Church; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 12:31AM EDT until August 08 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, THE CITY OF ALEXANDRIA AND THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY, NORTHERN PRINCE GEORGES, ARLINGTON AND EAST CENTRAL FAIRFAX COUNTIES... At 1231 AM EDT, Emergency Management reports all lanes of Rock Creek Parkway closed for flooding between Ohio Drive and Virginia Avenue. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arlington... Alexandria... Bethesda... Bowie... Annandale... College Park... Fort Washington... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Fort Hunt... Vienna... Groveton... Forestville... Falls Church... Huntington... Largo... Coral Hills... Bladensburg... Pimmit Hills... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
